autopdex.solver.linear_solve_pardisoÔÉÅ

autopdex.solver.linear_solve_pardiso(mat, rhs, solver, verbose, free_dofs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Solve a linear system using the PARDISO solver (requires Intel MKL and pypardiso(‚Äòlu‚Äô) or sparse_dot_mkl(‚Äòqr‚Äô) to be installed).

This function solves a linear system using PARDISO, with options for different solver types. The input matrix is first converted to a SciPy CSR matrix, and rows and columns corresponding to Dirichlet DOFs are optionally removed.

Parameters:

  • mat (jax.experimental.sparse.BCOO) ‚Äì The input matrix in JAX BCOO format.

  • rhs (jnp.ndarray) ‚Äì The (reduced/free) right-hand side vector.

  • solver (str) ‚Äì The type of solver to use (‚Äòlu‚Äô or ‚Äòqr‚Äô).

  • verbose (int) ‚Äì Verbosity level. If >= 2, timing information is printed.

  • free_dofs (array or None) ‚Äì Boolean array indicating which degrees of freedom are free.

Returns:

The solution vector.

Return type:

jax.numpy.array
